page.title: 05ST.PETERS CHURCH FRESHFORD
page.content: The church was built around 1250 in the centre of Freshford or "Firfordia" as it was called then. It was enlarged in 1450 when a new tower was built.The tower still remains today and is decorated with angels and other creatures.The church was enlarged in 1630 with a north aisle because an increase in cloth manufacturing also meant an increase in the population.In about 1730 this aisle was fitted with a gallery.In about 1800 the north aisle was made larger because the population was still increasing.There were many changes during the 2nd half of the 19th century.The chancel was enlarged in 1859,an organ was installed in 1868 and the bells were recast in 1885.Today the church shares a rector with Limpley Stoke and Hinton Charterhouse.It can seat 220 people.
